GLPS Platform Abstraction Layer

A lightweight, high-performance abstraction API for Windows and Linux systems, powering GooeyGUI and other cross-platform applications.

Get Started View on GitHub

About GLPS

GLPS (Generic Low-level Platform Services) provides a clean, consistent interface for platform-specific functionality across Windows and Linux systems. Designed for performance and minimal overhead, it serves as the foundation for GooeyGUI.

System Abstraction

Uniform interface for filesystem, threading, timers, and other OS services with native performance.

No Dependencies

Written in pure C. No heavyweight frameworks required.

Modular Design

Use only the components you need - windowing, input, graphics context, etc.

Documentation

Initialization

Basic setup for a GLPS application:

#include <GLPS/glps_window_manager.h>

int main(int argc, char** argv) {
    // Initialize the GLPS window manager component. 
    // The window manager is responsible for window creation/destruction,
    // user input and graphics context creation. 
    glps_WindowManager *wm = glps_wm_init();

    // Create a window
    // This returns a unique ID for each window.
    size_t win_id = glps_wm_window_create("My App", 800, 600);

    // Main application loop
    while (!glps_wm_should_close(window)) {
        // Draw funcs (OpenGL, Vulkan, etc..)
    }

    // Cleanup
    glps_wm_window_destroy(wm, win_id);
    glps_wm_destroy(wm);
    return 0;
}

Platform Services

Accessing system services through GLPS:


// Include threads
#include <GLPS/glps_thread.h>

// Thread handle
static gthread_t thread;

// Thread creation
glps_thread_create(&thread, NULL, thread_func, NULL);

GooeyGUI

GLPS is the foundation for GooeyGUI, a lightweight immediate-mode GUI library for embedded and performance-sensitive applications.

GooeyGUI Project

Getting GLPS

GLPS is available as a single-header library or can be built as a static library for better performance. 

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/GooeyUI/GLPS.git glps
cd glps

# Build and install (optional)
cmake -S . -B build
make
sudo make install
